availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Starks (Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Gibson Starks on in Todd County, Kentucky, August 28, 1837. Father of R. Starks, J. F. Starks, and Howell Starks. Married to Eliza Smith Starks in Calloway County on March 19, 1845. Father of Edmund Starks and E. A. Starks. Step father to J. Smith, J. Smith, A. Smith, and E. Smith. Farmer in Calloway County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860.
